gameelements
Class GameSituation

java.lang.Object
  gameelements.GameSituation
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class GameSituation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

This class holds information about a certain game situation on a game board, like the number and color of game tokens in each field. It thus represents the core of the game. It is used for displaying the situation on the gui as well as for calculations on future moves.

Nested Class Summary
static class GameSituation.FieldSetup
          Class that contains properties for setting up a field within a board at initialization, to present a preceded game situation.

Constructor Detail

GameSituation

public GameSituation(GameBoard gameBoard,
                     java.util.List<GameSituation.FieldSetup> initialFieldSettings)
Constructs a game situation, either with predefined setup or with no tokens placed at all.

Parameters:
gameBoard - the gameBoard holding the dimensions and structural properties of a corresponding board.
initialFieldSettings - list of setup entities for initializing a board with a preceded game situation.

getColor

public GameColor getColor(Position pos)
Returns the color of the tokens placed in the field of the given position. Returns null, if field is empty.

Parameters:
pos - theposition of the game field.
Returns:
the color of the tokens in this field.

isFull

public boolean isFull(Position pos)
Indicates, if field of the given position has reached its capacity or if it can take another number of tokens.

Parameters:
pos -
Returns:
returns true, if field will overflow with an additional token, otherwise returns false.

isFlowingOver

public boolean isFlowingOver(Position pos)
Indicates, if a field is currently in the state of flowing over.

Parameters:
pos - the position of the field.
Returns:
returns true, if field is currently flowing over.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty(Position pos)
Indicates, if a field is empty or holds tokens.

Parameters:
pos - the position of the field.
Returns:
returns true, if field does not contain any tokens.

addToken

public void addToken(Position pos,
                     GameColor color,
                     boolean display)
Adds a token of the given color in a given field. An overflow is being triggered in case of a full field.

Parameters:
pos - the position of the field.
color - the color of the token being added.

relocateToken

void relocateToken(Position pos,
                   GameColor color)
Adds a token of the given color in a given field. Does not trigger any overflows. Just adds the token to the field and changes the the color of already placed tokens in the field, if they have a different color.

Parameters:
pos - the position of the field.
color - the color of the token being added.

removeToken

GameColor removeToken(Position pos)
Removes a token from a field.

Parameters:
pos - the position of the field.
Returns:
the color of the removed token.

getColor

public GameColor getColor()
Returns the color of the board, if it is uni-colored. Returns null, if the containig fields still hold both colors. Also returns null, if there are less than two tokens placed on the board.

Returns:
the color of the board, if uni-colored, else null.

isUniColored

public boolean isUniColored()
Returns true if all fields of the board are either empty or hold tokens of the same color. There have to be at least two tokens placed on board to be considerered uni-colored.

Returns:
true, if all fields are in the same color.

clone

public GameSituation clone()
Overrides:
